reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the Hotel Aurora for 3 nights on July 8-11. I Loved the Aurora. I originally contacted the hotel via email since they appeared to be unavailable and they were always prompt and welcoming with their responses.(when doing booking-you have to fill out request and fax it back with passport and credit card to hotel directly and they take 1 nights stay deposit)
reviews.title: Loved the Aurora

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Aurora is fine if you are a group of guys hoping to roll out of bed and literally head across the street to an off-piste ski extravaganza but for anyone else, it has not much to offer except a reasonable price. We knew the current options for accommodations in Andermatt were limited (big changes are coming as large development is underway) but we had no idea one of the top options would be so disappointing.
reviews.title: One step above a Hostel

reviews.text: To begin with, you must enter through the restaurant as there is no lobby and the front entrance (the small door between the gas station and the restaurant) is often locked from both the inside and out. They proudly advertise that they have built a "smoking room" in the restaurant to which you must pass through to get to the glass-windowed "reception window". Yuk! The rooms are non smoking and do not have the residual smell but our clothes and bags already wreaked just from entering the hotel. They give you 1 traditional key (not a key card) for unlocking the front entrance but if you split up, you are out of luck. There is no place to spend any time besides the room if you are not skiing for the day and the town closes down from 12h - 14h.
reviews.title: Nice place for ski week-end
Location, service and price
reviews.text: The rooms are clean but accommodations are a bare minimum. It appears they have not been updated since the early 1970's. Linens, towels and beds are rough and uncomfortable. Power outlets (an essential these days) are few and very, very far between (not even one for the blow dryer in the bathroom). The bathroom is miniscule and the tiny shower stall offers water that fluctuates from cold to scalding in seconds. The Wifi is strong but they charge extra to use the sauna.

Breakfast was OK. Nothing to write home about but I will add it wasn't good enough to invite us to dine in the restaurant at other times. I can't say how the staff was because no one was ever in the office. We had to search for someone both at check in and check out. To add insult to injury there were groups of skiers enjoying apres-ski (and later into the evening), hanging out and socializing in the halls with the doors to their rooms open.........think college dorm.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Changes are coming to Andermatt but until then, I would strongly consider staying somewhere else.
reviews.title: OK for the money

reviews.text: Staff are very friendly but some tips.
reviews.title: Great Hotel plus something extra
You may want to avoid Room 7
reviews.text: Make sure you do NOT drive into the old town without a permit and the Hotel will supply one so you can park and drive in the old town.

reviews.title: Super Birthday Trip
reviews.text: Plenty of great restaurants and shops plus a must see is the Colliseum type theatre and take the walk up MANY steps to the old castle overlooking the old town....on the way collect some cheese and ham with a nice bottle of wine and enjoy the view from the castle on dusk!!!
